gdpr_acceptance.header: Has the tenant or buyer seen the Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities (DLUHC) privacy notice?
gdpr_acceptance.hint_text: You must show the privacy notice to the tenant or buyer before you can use this service.

gdpr_declined.description:
We cannot accept data about a tenant or buyer unless they’ve seen the DLUHC privacy notice.

Go to your logs

renewal.hint_text: A renewal is a letting to the same tenant in the same property.

tenant_code.hint_text: This is how you usually refer to this tenancy on your own systems.

household.description: Make sure the tenant has seen the Department for Levelling Up, Housing & Communities (DLUHC) privacy notice before completing this section.

layear.check_answer_label: How long has the household continuously lived in the local authority area where the new letting is located?
layear.header: How long has the household continuously lived in the local authority area where the new letting is located?

answer_options.0: Just moved to local authority area

lawaitlist.check_answer_label: How long has the household been on the local authority waiting list where the new letting is located?
lawaitlist.header: How long has the household been on the local authority waiting list where the new letting is located?

answer_options.0: Just moved to local authority area

reason.header: What is the tenant’s main reason for leaving?

answer_options.0: Permanently decanted from another property owned by this landlord
answer_options.1: Left home country as a refugee
answer_options.5: Asked to leave by family or friends
answer_options.9: End of assured shorthold tenancy - no fault
answer_options.10: End of assured shorthold tenancy - tenant’s fault
answer_options.11: End of fixed term tenancy - no fault
answer_options.12: End of fixed term tenancy - tenant’s fault
answer_options.14: Under occupation - offered incentive to downsize
answer_options.16: Property unsuitable because of ill health / disability
answer_options.17: Property unsuitable because of poor condition
answer_options.18: Couldn’t afford fees attached to renewing the tenancy
answer_options.20: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - welfare reforms
answer_options.21: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - employment
answer_options.22: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - other
answer_options.23: To move nearer to family / friends / school
answer_options.25: To move to accomodation with support
answer_options.28: Death of household member in last settled accomodation
answer_options.30: Discharged from long stay hospital or similar institution

other_reason_for_leaving_last_settled_ho.header: Please state the reason for leaving last settled home

underoccupation_benefitcap.header: Was the reason for leaving because of the benefit cap or removal of the spare room subsidy?

answer_options.1: Yes - removal of the spare room subsidy
answer_options.2: Yes - both the benefit cap and the removal of the spare room subsidy

prevten.header: What was the tenant’s housing situation immediately before this letting?

answer_options.3: Tied housing or rented with job
answer_options.19: Fixed term Local Authority General Needs tenancy
answer_options.20: Lifetime Local Authority General Needs tenancy
answer_options.21: Fixed term PRP General Needs tenancy

homeless.header: Did the tenant experience homelessness immediately before this letting?

answer_options.0: Yes - assessed as homeless by a local authority and owed a homelessness duty. Including if threatened with homelessness within 56 days

prevloc.check_answer_label: The LA in which household lived immediately before this letting
prevloc.header: Which local authority area did the household live in immediately before this letting?

previous_postcode.check_answer_label: Postcode of previous accommodation if the household has moved from settled accommodation
previous_postcode.hint_text: If the household has moved from settled accommodation immediately prior to being re-housed.

reasonpref.check_answer_label: Was the household given Reasonable Preference (i.e. priority) for housing by the Local Authority?
reasonpref.header: Was the household given reasonable preference by the local authority?

reasonable_preference_reason.header: Reason for reasonable preference being given
Why were they given reasonable preference?

answer_options.rp_homeless: Homeless or about to lose their home (within 56 days)
answer_options.rp_insan_unsat: Living in insanitary or overcrowded or unsatisfactory housing
answer_options.rp_medwel: A need to move on medical and welfare grounds (including a disability)
answer_options.rp_hardship: A need to move to avoid hardship to themselves or others

cbl.header: Was the letting made under choice-based lettings (CBL)?

chr.header: Was the letting made under common housing register (CHR)?

cap.header: Was the letting made under common allocation policy (CAP)?

referral.header: What was the source of referral for this letting?

answer_options.1: Tenant applied directly (no referral or nomination)
answer_options.2: Private registered provider (PRP) lettings only - nominated by a local housing authority
answer_options.3: Private registered provider (PRP) supported lettings only - referred by local authority housing department
answer_options.4: Re-located through official housing mobility scheme

armed_forces.header: Experience of the UK Armed Forces

answer_options.0: A current or former regular in the UK Armed Forces (excluding National Service)
answer_options.1: A current or former reserve in the UK Armed Forces (excluding National Service)
answer_options.2: A spouse / civil partner of a UK Armed Forces member who has separated or been bereaved within the last 2 years

armed_forces_member.header: Experience of the UK Armed Forces

depends_on.armedforces: A current or former regular in the UK Armed Forces (excluding National Service)

leftreg.check_answer_label: When did they leave the Armed Forces?

answer_options.1: No - they left up to 5 years ago
answer_options.2: No - they left more than 5 years ago

reservist.header: Were they seriously injured or ill as a result of their service?
reservist.check_answer_label: Has anyone in the household been seriously injured or ill as a result of their service in the armed forces?

illness.header:
Does anyone in the household have any of the following that they expect to last for 12 months or more:
  • Physical Condition
  • Mental Health Condition
  • Other Illness
illness.check_answer_label: Physical, mental health or illness in the household

preg_occ.header: Is anyone in the household pregnant?

accessibility_requirements.header: Are any of these affected by their condition or illness?

condition_effects.header: Are any of these affected by their condition or illness?

answer_options.illness_type_1: Vision - such as blindness or partial sight
answer_options.illness_type_2: Hearing - such as deafness or partial hearing
answer_options.illness_type_3: Mobility - such as walking short distances or climbing stairs
answer_options.illness_type_4: Dexterity - such as lifting and carrying objects or using a keyboard
answer_options.illness_type_7: Mental health - such as depression, anxiety, schizophrenia or bipolar
answer_options.illness_type_9: Socially or behaviourally - such as those associated with autism spectral disorder (ASD) including Aspergers’ or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD))

startertenancy.check_answer_label: Is this a starter or introductory tenancy?

tenancy.header: What is the type of tenancy?

tenancy.check_answer_label: Type of main tenancy after the starter period has ended?
tenancy.header: What is the type of tenancy after the starter period has ended?
tenancy.hint_text: This is also known as an ‘introductory period’.

tenancylength.header: What is the length of the fixed-term tenancy to the nearest year?

letting_in_sheltered_accomodation.check_answer_label: Is this letting in sheltered accommodation?
letting_in_sheltered_accomodation.header: Is this letting in sheltered accommodation?

postcode_known.check_answer_label: Do you know the property postcode?
postcode_known.header: Do you know the property’s postcode?

la_known.check_answer_label: Do you know what local authority the property is located in?
la_known.header: Do you know what local authority the property is located in?

first_time_property_let_as_social_housin.check_answer_label: First time being let as social-housing?
first_time_property_let_as_social_housin.header: Is this the first time the property has been let as social housing?

unitletas.header: What type was the property most recently let as?

rsnvac.header: What is the reason for the property being vacant?

answer_options.1: Internal transfer (excluding renewals of a fixed-term tenancy)
answer_options.2: Relet to tenant who occupied same property as temporary accommodation
answer_options.3: Tenant involved in a succession downsize
answer_options.4: Tenant moved to private sector or other accommodation
answer_options.5: Tenant moved to other social housing provider
answer_options.9: Tenant evicted due to ASB or other reason

rsnvac.header: What is the reason for the property being vacant?

answer_options.12: First let of conversion, rehabilitation or acquired property

offered.check_answer_label: Times previously offered since becoming available
offered.header: Since becoming available for re-let, how many times has the property been previously offered?
offered.hint_text: If the property is being offered for let for the first time, enter 0.

offered.check_answer_label: Times previously offered since becoming available
offered.header: Since becoming available, how many times has the property been previously offered?
offered.hint_text: If the property is being let for the first time, enter 0.

unittype_gn.header: What type of unit is the property?

builtype.header: What type of building is the property?

answer_options.1: Converted from previous residential or non-residential property

wchair.check_answer_label: Property built or adapted to wheelchair-user standards
wchair.header: Is the property built or adapted to wheelchair-user standards?

beds.header: How many bedrooms does the property have?
beds.hint_text: If shared accommodation, enter the number of bedrooms occupied by this household. A bedsit has 1 bedroom.

property_void_date.header: What is the void or renewal date?
What is the new-build handover date?

rsnvac: First let of conversion, rehabilitation or acquired property?

majorrepairs.check_answer_label: Major repairs carried out during void period
majorrepairs.header: Were any major repairs carried out during the void period?
majorrepairs.hint_text: Major repairs are works that could not be reasonably carried out with a tenant living at the property. For example, structural repairs.

net_income_known.header: How often does the household receive income?

earnings.header: How much income does the household have in total every week?
How much income does the household have in total every month?
How much income does the household have in total every year?

hb.header: Is the household likely to be receiving any of these housing-related benefits?

answer_options.2: Housing benefit and Universal Credit (without housing element)
answer_options.1: Universal Credit with housing element (excluding housing benefit)

benefits.check_answer_label: Household income from Universal Credit, state pension or benefits
benefits.header: How much of the household’s income is from Universal Credit, state pensions or benefits?
benefits.hint_text: This excludes child and housing benefit, council tax support and tax credits.

household_charge.check_answer_label: Does the household pay rent or charges?
household_charge.header: Does the household pay rent or other charges for the accommodation?

period.check_answer_label: Frequency of household rent and charges
period.header: How often does the household pay rent and other charges?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every week?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every 2 weeks?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every 4 weeks?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every month?

brent.hint_text: This is the amount paid before any charges are added for services (for example, hot water or cleaning). Households may receive housing benefit or Universal Credit towards basic rent.

scharge.hint_text: For example, for cleaning. Households may receive housing benefit or Universal Credit towards the service charge.

pscharge.header: What is the personal service charge?
pscharge.hint_text: For example, for heating or hot water. This doesn’t include housing benefit or Universal Credit.

supcharg.hint_text: Any charges made to fund support services included in tenancy agreement.

tcharge.hint_text: This is the total for rent and all charges.

hbrentshortfall.check_answer_label: Outstanding amount for basic rent and charges
hbrentshortfall.header: After the household has received any housing-related benefits, will they still need to pay for rent and charges?

tshortfall.header: What do you expect the outstanding amount to be?
tshortfall.hint_text: Give an estimated amount if you don’t know the exact figure.
